explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of a Multi-Criteria Optimization Classifier (MCOC) and its enhanced version (KFP-MCOC) for credit risk evaluation, which falls under the umbrella of machine learning.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper involves building a classifier using labeled training data to predict the credit risk of new applicants, which is a supervised learning task.
explanations.classification: The primary goal of the paper is to classify credit applicants into different risk categories using the proposed KFP-MCOC model.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper compares the proposed KFP-MCOC model with support vector machines (SVM) in the context of credit risk evaluation.
explanations.SVM: The paper explicitly mentions support vector machines (SVM) as one of the comparative methods in the experimental results.
